website_summaries.verdict: This is a good guide for birdwatchers who are just starting out, although some may find that the photos don't work as well as illustrations when it comes to identifying birds.
pros: Easy to navigate, and a good compact size for field use
Has a lot of info up front for beginner birdwatchers (how to choose binoculars, etc.)
Index at the end has check boxes so you can keep track of sightings
cons: Published in 2005, making it a bit outdated
Some felt that this guide is not organized well, and that the photos don't compare with the illustrations and paintings of other guides

customer_reviews.title: In the 54 years of my birding this is the Best Birding Book I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this birding book for my daughter for xmas. I have had mine for a long time. This birding book is superior to all of the other ones i have owned. (Roger Tory Peterson; National Geographic, etc. ) The book is a perfec size; has maps; photos of the birds rather than drawings; the thing i love MOST is the index at the back. There is an “at a glance page” that allows you to go to each main bird with the page number. So helpful when trying identify a fire FAST. Soon i am going to get another one for me. One for the house and one for the car.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Bach

customer_reviews.title: A Great Find for Birding/Bird Watching
customer_reviews.text: This field guide is simple but complete. The book makes it easy to identify birds based on region and time of year, as well as how rare or common the bird is. The intro gives you a good idea if you're a beginner on key words for identifying and general information. It's compact and the size makes it easy for traveling with too! The back of book has an index for easily finding types of birds that includes a check box next to each name so you can keep track of what kinds you've encountered. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great functional field guide.
customer_reviews.text: As a new birder this is probably my favorite guide. It has quite a bit of basic information about birding up front. It's compact enough to carry everywhere, and I find the comparative illustrations of similar birds well organized for deciding among them. I usually find myself using this book first and then checking out one of the larger ones if I have doubts or want to read more about the bird.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Kaufman. The Name Says It All
customer_reviews.text: Kaufman never fails to impress and absolutely never disappoints! I love that there are photo renditions and excellent-to-read range maps with legends that are easy to see and read. I love that the photos show the birds doing what they actually do, rather than just a basic side-view of the bird. Maybe some day I can get a photo or two of my birds in his book :)
customer_reviews.author: L. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Who Is That Bird?
customer_reviews.text: Our previous bird book was old and falling apart. We were introduced to the Kaufman Field Guide by an article in a bird magazine. This Guide was every thing we were hoping for in a bird book.
customer_reviews.author: Donald L. Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Bird identification by photos
customer_reviews.text: I have discovered that some birders swear by guides done in drawing and some to photos. Perhaps because I photograph also, I loved this book. I think that the birds look more realistic and distinct than with the books with drawings. I have lots of those to, but this is the field guide I take with me and it is my go to book. If you do photography, this may be the book for you.
customer_reviews.author: Cat alog

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best field guides ever. We have four copies for my family. We all love to have our own when we are birding. I just bought one for my niece, too, and my sister said that they are especially happy for it since they are getting into birding. This is an excellent source to identify birds and learn about them. Very high quality, too.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly S

customer_reviews.title: Eh... It's okay
customer_reviews.text: Not the kind of book I was expecting. I wanted pictures like I later found in the National Wildlife Federation's Field Guide to Birds of North America. If you want good pictures for identification I would buy that one instead. I am keeping this one but it's not my go to book.
customer_reviews.author: P. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Great guide for the beginning birder
customer_reviews.text: This was described to me as a good guide for beginning birders. There are plenty of photos and descriptions of the birds, as well as range maps showing where the birds are likely to be found at different times of year. The maps are color-coded: red for summer, blue for winter and gray for migrating. Purple means the birds stay in one location year-round. Similar species are grouped together, with photos on one page and descriptions on the facing page. There are tips for identifying birds, including their calls, and on choosing and using binoculars. This is a detailed guide for the novice birder. Its compact size makes it easy to take along on birding expeditions.
customer_reviews.author: Divascribe

customer_reviews.title: This is a great field guide for new birders
customer_reviews.text: I lead weekly educational bird walks as a volunteer and frequently I have children, young adults and new birders on my walks. I found this field guide about five years ago love it for these walks because it is small, light-weight, has real photos of the birds and it's easy to understanding. I use it as a teaching tool, encouraging new birders to read the "yellow pages" for a course in "Birding l0l." Now days I buy about a dozen at a time and "gift" them to new birders on my walks to encourage them to learn about the birds they see. And it Works!
customer_reviews.author: Lucille Ormond

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Fun and Informative
customer_reviews.text: This Field Guide is very well suited to the amateur as well as the more serious bird watcher. Who would have thought to actually explain why a "Field Guide" is the right style and to help distinguish between "bird watcher" and "birder" among other bits of interesting stuff. Mr. Kaufman makes tracking down the identity of a specific bird much simpler than many other bird books. It is fun to use and seems very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: John K Stovall

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter fell in love with bird watching and this book really does fantastic job at helping her identify the birds. It's obvious why everyone rates this so high and why my google search said this was the best book to buy.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Only book needed
customer_reviews.text: Been using Ken Kaufmann book for years and wanted to get updated version. Have every field guide and use them all. This book is really all you need to carry on field to id your bird in northeast. Others like Peterson may be useful as backup on some details.
customer_reviews.author: Radek2

customer_reviews.title: Great for the field
customer_reviews.text: I carry this one in the field, even fits in my back pocket. Very easy to use for an intermediate birder, excellent pictures and descriptions.
customer_reviews.author: ♫NewHorizons♫

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Easy to navigate, very clear illustrations. Not the tiniest you could probably but, but still easy to carry and big enough that you're not straining your eyes.
customer_reviews.author: BKH

customer_reviews.title: It is a good quick reference field guide for any birder.
customer_reviews.text: We had one of these field guides that was printed many years ago and we wore it out. It was falling apart so we thought we would order a new one. Out of all the field guides we have used this one is easy to use and has a lot of pictures, information to help identify birds, and range maps. I would recommend this guide for new birders and experienced birders. It is an all round good field guide.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Why you need another bird book
customer_reviews.text: I was in a group as we looked for birds and learned hot to net them, band them, and release them. At the end during "Question and Answer" time, we noticed that the instructors were using Kaufman's book. When asked why they said it had exceptional order and was great for all ages. Later, at the shop associated with the trip, I saw the book and saw that it would be perfect for my young birding grandchildren. Bird watching is an excellent hobby for people from 1-101 so I'm sure I made a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J. Van Fleet

customer_reviews.title: A great bird identification book
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this book. It has some similarities to the old Chan Robbins guide I loved so much. It is well organised and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: L. C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good Bird Book
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a supplement to my Petersen bird guide. Seems to have more photos and choices. A good addition to my library.
customer_reviews.author: TCB47

customer_reviews.title: A great beginners guide!!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I just started getting into bird watching. We wanted a guide that would help us as beginners. This has been nothing but perfect. We have had it a couple of months and eagerly checking off our list! A perfect back yard book, that has served us well at our local pars too. The images are descriptions are so helpful. Get this guide! You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bawlmer

customer_reviews.title: Super!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift. I have heard from the the recipient that it was a wonderful book!
customer_reviews.author: Violets

customer_reviews.title: Excellent resource especially as a field guide - the best ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent resource especially as a field guide - the best organized for that purpose of the five different references I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fahle

customer_reviews.title: A Great Book For Those Interested In Identifying Birds
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for my dad. He loves identifying different birds that he sees in his yard. The book is very nice. Colorful pages with lots of information regarding the different species of birds.
customer_reviews.author: WhiteRabbit

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to find the bird you are looking for. Great pictures. Easy to see their seasonal locations!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: It was a good choice. I have no difficulty finding the birds ...
customer_reviews.text: We misplaced our Audubon book, and replaced it with this one. It was a good choice. I have no difficulty finding the birds I am looking for, and the pictures are closer to what I actually see in the bird. Would definitely recommend this over the Audubon book for novice birders like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Thomas

customer_reviews.title: My wife’s favorite bird book.
customer_reviews.text: This is my wife’s favorite bird book. She has looked at several other and always goes back to this one. She likes how it is set up and easy for her to fine the birds she is looking for quick.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Blake

customer_reviews.title: but love the fact that the new bird at the feeder ...
customer_reviews.text: Not an avid birder, but love the fact that the new bird at the feeder can be identified. Not sure if it is easier to use than other books, but it certainly has a great deal of information, and seems to be layed out predictably.
customer_reviews.author: Citizen Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Good Guide for Young Birders
customer_reviews.text: The Yolo Audubon Society (Davis, CA) settled on Kaufman's for our education program. We found that the size and detail offered is very appropriate for 5th graders. I also use it on our general public field trips and it seems to appeal to adults new to birdwatching. The inclusion of typical habit in the text for the birds is helpful, as are the clear illustrations. For example, look up Hutton's Vireo and a picture of the Ruby-crowned Kinglet is provided that helps the kids notice the difference between the two birds.
customer_reviews.author: Ken E.

customer_reviews.title: Very Best!
customer_reviews.text: You can never go wrong with a Kaufman Book. My husband is a birder and he absolutely loves these books. He likes that the pictures in these books are photographs and not drawings which can be very liberal with colors exaggerating identifying marks. Kaufman will always be the book he carries around.
customer_reviews.author: melissa emery

customer_reviews.title: Not photos
customer_reviews.text: Not what I thought. I thought It had actual photos of each bird, not drawings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch Information
customer_reviews.text: Very comprehensive and well done. It covers just about everything you will need for beginning bird watching. I just wish it was larger. It is paperback, but is on the small side. On the plus side, it is easy to put in your backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: the bird bible
customer_reviews.text: This is the best book out there as they are photos and not drawings, and they show juvenile and adult male vs. female in most all the species (unless you cannot tell the difference between the males and females). I own a couple other books, and this is the best one for identification purposes. It tells what time of year and where you see the birds.
customer_reviews.author: L. DONOVAN

customer_reviews.title: As a new "birder" this book is absolutely amazing and completely invaluable
customer_reviews.text: As a new "birder" this book is absolutely amazing and completely invaluable. The (subtle) tips the author gives help greatly, and the birds are surprisingly easy to find even while flipping through the book. There is nothing I can add that the positive comments haven't already covered. I would absolutely recommend this book to anyone interested in birds.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome book. A friend recommended it to me
customer_reviews.text: Awesome book. A friend recommended it to me. I am fairly new to S Texas and wasn't familiar with the birds here. This is so easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Biker Granny

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use for a novice with good pictures, organized content, and easy to understand facts
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: add this to your collection
customer_reviews.text: We used the book from the day we got it. It is great that it shows different seasons of the birds so you can recognize them whenever they show up.
customer_reviews.author: RCA

customer_reviews.title: the best
customer_reviews.text: Ok simply the best guide out there need to say no more.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Mandel

customer_reviews.title: Best guide for all levels of birders!
customer_reviews.text: Take this one with you. It is a great help in identifying both groups of birds and individual species. Many practical tips make identification pretty straightforward for most species. Best single source available for quick reference in the field and at home!
customer_reviews.author: lynnie

customer_reviews.title: Very good pictures and clear descriptions
customer_reviews.text: Very handy quick reference when you're watching birds out your window. Very good pictures and clear descriptions.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn in Texas

customer_reviews.title: My go-to field guide for birding
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to field guide. It's perfect in every way, size is great for a large pocket or backpack. There's a great index for easy finding of species. The beginning features a beginner guide to birding with parts of birds "field marks" explained. The photos and range maps are very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Talbot

customer_reviews.title: Great informative bird book!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT book. Beautiful photos and good information. We have it on our table so it’s easily accessible!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Ketchum

customer_reviews.title: Fun to compare the "new" names of "old" birds
customer_reviews.text: I keep this next to my original bird book (which is 40 years old). Fun to compare the "new" names of "old" birds.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Kenn Kaufman makes identifying birds about as clear and easy as it can get
customer_reviews.text: Kenn Kaufman makes identifying birds about as clear and easy as it can get. I like his color coding of birds so you can find the name of the mystery bird you're watching before it leaves your feeder or nearby branch. The maps of the US showing the bird's usual ranges also help assure you of birds' identity.
customer_reviews.author: K. Oliver

customer_reviews.title: my go-to guide
customer_reviews.text: Ken Kaufman's book is one of the best. It is water resistant, has all info on the same page with photos and is small enough to be comfortable to carry all day. I can identify a bird faster with this book because of its layout. When birding you need more than one guide sometimes to make a decision on a tough to identify bird sighting. But one of them should always be this one.
customer_reviews.author: Smartcows

customer_reviews.title: Great resource
customer_reviews.text: Love this book, although it isn’t for quick, on the spot lookups.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis W. McMaken

customer_reviews.title: A great first (or second) field guide
customer_reviews.text: This is a great first field guide for a beginning birder or as an addition/companion to your collection. It compliments my favorite Peterson guide nicely, and with two birders in the house, it's always helpful to have more than one field guide! The grouping of the birds is not taxonomic (like Peterson's) so that took a bit getting used to, but it doesn't detract from the overall usefulness of this book at home or in the field. There is lots of great information in the front of the guide on identifying birds, choosing binoculars, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie S.

customer_reviews.title: The true Field Guide.
customer_reviews.text: I have most of the field guides to the birds of North America. This is in my opinion the best. It has the best build quality like the old Peterson guides. Perfect size for field carry. Very colorful and informative with real life pictures that have been improved through digital photography technology. This is the one to get although it needs to be revised as it was released in 2005. Mr. Kaufman, a lot readers like me are waiting for a new version to come out soon !!!
customer_reviews.author: G. Q.

customer_reviews.title: Practical Field Guide
customer_reviews.text: This is very well written and provides photographs that make bird identification easy. Kaufman is an excellent author of several bird books, and is considered an expert in this field. We bought this book to make bird identification easier. We can then gain amplified information from the Bird Encyclopedia which requires a the knowledge of a bird's classification.
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Northrip

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I are enjoying this book a lot! Nice size and perfect for hiking!
customer_reviews.author: Emy O

customer_reviews.title: Great bird book for identification purposes
customer_reviews.text: Best bird book I have ever seen - pictures and varieties are exceptional. I was able to identify a small bird that appeared here this year and stayed all by himself for several months. A Thompson Warbler.
customer_reviews.author: IAMME

customer_reviews.title: Kaufman Field Guide to Birds Fully Meets Our Expectations
customer_reviews.text: The Kaufman Field Guide to Birds of North America was recommended to us by wildlife artist Adam Grimm, two time winner of the U.S. Federal Duck Stamp competition. Adam recommended this book to us as an economical, fairly comprehensive, easy to use guide that would have accurate images for ease of identification. In his paintings Adam is particularly concerned about anatomy. We have found the Kaufman Field Guide to fully meet our expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Lee McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Inspired me to bird watch even more!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've purchased, this time as a gift! Love the introductory material almost as much as the actual content/pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Great bird book
customer_reviews.text: Love this bird book. It's very informative and the pictures are great!
customer_reviews.author: kathy gartner

customer_reviews.title: Good book
customer_reviews.text: Great book, easy to read and full of pictures. I found an eagle.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba Gump

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these books in my lifetime and I can always find the names, habits and locations of birds. I'm getting this for my daughter-in-law in hopes she enjoys it as much as me.
customer_reviews.author: Connie S. Platt

customer_reviews.title: Kaufman Is What I Needed !
customer_reviews.text: Great source for songbirds in North Carolina - moved from Florida, where I was used to large waterbirds .. Kaufman has helped in IDs of the guests dining out back.. it is put together much like Kaufman Filed Guide to Butterflies of North America (which goes with me ) .. thanks !
customer_reviews.author: Peggy C

customer_reviews.title: Kaufman Field Guide to Birds of North America
customer_reviews.text: This book was recommended by a friend who is an avid bird watcher. It is a very good book especially for beginning bird watchers. It has maps that are color coded for season, pictures of male and female species and good descriptors. Good index and good beginnning overview.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Bourn

customer_reviews.title: Best book
customer_reviews.text: I love this field guide and have had a great time using it
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: The size and ease of use make this book the best of what's out there to take in the field
customer_reviews.text: My go-to guide for quick, in the field ID's (though I do find myself using iBird pro on my phone more and more). The size and ease of use make this book the best of what's out there to take in the field. I don't buy that it's just a beginner's guide. At home, I use the bigger references to solve more difficult ID's.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Faneuff Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful guide. It is easy to use. We recommend this guide.
customer_reviews.author: B Young

customer_reviews.title: fun for novice birders
customer_reviews.text: bought our own copy after borrowing this from the library. fun for novice birders!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Tsang

customer_reviews.title: Great book even for a beginner.
customer_reviews.text: Great field guide and perfect for a beginner like me.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Evans

customer_reviews.title: Kaufman/Birds of N. America
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book along with a couple others to supplement the Peterson and Sibley I already owned. I like the lay-out and quality of the paintings. The pages are thick and the whole manufacturing process well made. I carry this book as much as any with me. Thanks amazon for the prompt delivery.
customer_reviews.author: buffalo sam

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 8yo
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 8 yo. He loves it. Easy to use, informative and easy to carry!
customer_reviews.author: Piglet

customer_reviews.title: Put this one in your birding library
customer_reviews.text: Kaufman is a guiding force in Ohio at Crane Creek. His observations, lectures, and photos have brought birding into the 21st center during the great week of birding. If you are ever in the area in April don't miss him and the event.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda A. Young

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, color pictures
customer_reviews.text: Book is nice with color photos and small enough to carry with me on out of doors trips.
customer_reviews.author: Kim F.

customer_reviews.title: Best bird guide!
customer_reviews.text: This guide is amazing the pictures are shown for make female and juvenile for almost each bird. The categories are divided up so that the bird you need to identify is easy to look up in the guide. Pictures and information are extremely helpful and makes bird identification easier. I recommend this guide!
customer_reviews.author: L. T. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: ... had an older Peterson Field guide and that was good, but it was suggested that we get this ...
customer_reviews.text: We had an older Peterson Field guide and that was good, but it was suggested that we get this Kaufman Field guide and we love it. It has alot more bird photos and identifiers in it. We would recommend this Kaufman Guide, we really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Galen F. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Well planned out
customer_reviews.text: This is made up of photographs instead of illustrations. That can be both good and bad—I like both. The best thing about this guide is its organization. The color-coded edge-tabs help delineate different content groups. This is not my only guide, but it has become my most used.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton D., and Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Nice for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This book is a great beginner's bird watching book. It is simple to use and small enough to bring on my outings. It does not get very technical. The pictures are nice and give plenty of detail when identifying a particular bird. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon09

customer_reviews.title: Great bird book.
customer_reviews.text: I found this book informative and full if beautiful pictures.
customer_reviews.author: David Lockard

customer_reviews.title: Not the best guide for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: Not the best guide for a beginner. The photos are composites, look like they were shot at low resolution, and very nearly have a blurred appearance. Very hard to use if you normally wear reading glasses and forgot yours at home/in the car. It's smaller and more flexible than Sibleys', more durable, and fun to thumb through- one could say it has good "action". I bought it simply because I'm the kind of bloke who has to have a complete bird guide library, if only to know which guides to complain about.
customer_reviews.author: GoofyFoot

customer_reviews.title: Handy for all birders
customer_reviews.text: I have a dozen different bird field guides... none of them give me everything, but each gives something... This is a good guide to have on hand if you are into bird watching here in North America...
customer_reviews.author: BooCat Fan

customer_reviews.title: great pictures, makes it easy to identify birds
customer_reviews.text: we were replacing a golden field guide to birds that got dunked in the water....this one is great! Sturdy binding, good indexing, great pictures, I find it very easy to use. We enjoy identifying the birds around our home in Minnesota but are not "birdwatchers". I would recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wiese

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best organized and through ...."why this bird is this" guide ever created!!!!
customer_reviews.author: stableladyhawke

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: I am not an avid bird watcher but when we get a bird we don't recognize in our yard we can find it in this book. I have purchased several for friends and family and would recomend it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: makes bird watching simple yet informative - I love that you can search for a bird type based ...
customer_reviews.text: makes bird watching simple yet informative - I love that you can search for a bird type based on the color of the animal
customer_reviews.author: cheshirekrispy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A welcome addition to any collection of guides (because we all have more than one)
customer_reviews.author: Matt D

customer_reviews.title: Awesome book!
customer_reviews.text: Great book to help beginning or veteran birders. Clear pictures make it easy to identify.
customer_reviews.author: Di G

customer_reviews.title: Best bird ID book!
customer_reviews.text: This is my husband's favorite bird book! He's been a birder for most of his life---almost 60 years! We bought this book to give a friend who has become a birder! Easy to use. Good information.
customer_reviews.author: Gofer Gal

customer_reviews.title: For every birder's library
customer_reviews.text: Superb. An excellent addition to my birding library. All illustrations are photographs. Complements other references.
customer_reviews.author: David H Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Excellent resource.
customer_reviews.text: First introduced to this book at a bird watching session at our state park. Conservationist recommended this and we had hands on experience using this to identify birds during the session. Easy to use and great for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Malina F. Benson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I think this book is more useful than the famous Peterson Field Guide.
customer_reviews.author: EZ Riverman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A good birding guide book. Illustrations are about the best.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Covers birds of North America
customer_reviews.text: Very Informative and compact to carry with you if you need to refer back to it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great 'search and find' type of book
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well categorized by color coordinating types of birds. To find a bird you simply look under the category it belongs to (f.e. hummingbirds or chicken-like birds,...)and then simply browse through excellent pictures. It sure makes it easy and enjoyable. I browsed through a lot of bird books and this is the BEST one I saw.
customer_reviews.author: Regina C.

customer_reviews.title: Repeat customer
customer_reviews.text: The morphed photographs make it easy to identify birds. I love the colors. It was my first bird book 4-5 years ago, and I found its organization logical and innate. (I understand it's organized differently than more traditional books..) The pages are slick and sturdy which means that it withstood the abuse of being sprayed with salt water on my kayaking trips. My book is well used! This is the book I recommend or buy for friends who express an interest in bird watching.
customer_reviews.author: carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Bird Identification
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful in bird ID. I am a new birder & this book has been very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Colette

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: a much better help for the beginner at identifying birds than other books I have seen. Good illustrations and useful Keys to show range etc.
customer_reviews.author: Sam on the Hill

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, love it!
customer_reviews.text: I like that the images are real photos. It works so much better for me than a drawing. I have made this my go to book. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: M. Brock

customer_reviews.title: This is my third copy of this excellent book, which I use as my
customer_reviews.text: This is my third copy of this excellent book, which I use as my ;primary resource for identifying birds. Kaufman is the best, in my opinion -- he combines the benefits of photos and paintings by digitally adjusting the photos to reflect the most typical specimens.
customer_reviews.author: Rima

customer_reviews.title: Love my birds!!
customer_reviews.text: It was in good shape for being used and very informative!!
customer_reviews.author: judy archer

customer_reviews.title: Bird lovers alert!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best bird books you will find! Ordered for gifts for bird loving friends!
customer_reviews.author: Farm Wife & Momma

customer_reviews.title: One of the best bird books
customer_reviews.text: One of the best bird books. Pictures are great. Really help identify the birds and is small enough to take into the field.
customer_reviews.author: kittysfriend

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: This book has great pictures of the birds. Makes it easy to discribe the birds that you see at you feeders.
customer_reviews.author: angie

customer_reviews.title: great field guide.
customer_reviews.text: this is a nice book, pretty easy to find and identify the birds.
customer_reviews.author: daniel  caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Kaufman Guide
customer_reviews.text: Well I am very pleased with this book. It is my first time and this is easy and decisive. A good price and easy traveler.
customer_reviews.author: suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Birds of North America
customer_reviews.text: I already had one. Purchased for my Mom for Christmas. Great Bird book. It has many pictures which is one of my favorite things about the book.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Stepler

customer_reviews.title: get the vinyl
customer_reviews.text: love everything about this guide, especially the vinyl cover. its a great size and its very complete as far as your average birdwatcher is concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Steve N

customer_reviews.title: Super field guide.
customer_reviews.text: Very good field guide, but I'd recommend saving money and get the paper edition. The vinyl one is too stiff. As a guide, one of the best.
customer_reviews.author: Ron C.
